name: Claws of Furry
description:
Punch and claw your way through forty fast paced levels of pure mayhem, while honing your Ninja Cat skills, in order to rescue your Master from the evil claws of an unknown enemy.


Claws of Furry Claws of Furry creates a blend of today's fast paced action with classic arcade Beat'em up badassery. With four distinct environments with unique enemies, the challenge is always evolving. Multiple modes such as Rogue-like and Arena, and unlockable outfits with unique bonuses, will keep you coming back for more. Fear not the rogue-like though; with the Pussycat mode you can play the game with checkpoints in every level, in a classic linear adventure. This will not make it much easier though, fast reflexes and a keen eye are required in order to survive the journey to free your Master. You don't have to take this journey alone though; you can have a group of up to four people in local co-op!


• Arcade beat'em up action.
• Multiple Modes.
• Local co-op with up to 4 players.
• A variety of thematic environments and enemies.
• Beautiful hand-painted art.
• Unique character design.

Modes
• Pussycat
The regular campaign mode which is consisted by 44 thematically varied levels. Your progress of the players is saved each level. Up to 4 players in local co-op.
• Im-paw-ssible!
Take the Pussycat journey, but in Rogue-like fashion. The stage progress resets with every death. Fear not the Rogue-like though; the character progress is not lost, since the skills that are unlocked are saved; and ninja cats from other modes will be available as well. Up to 4 players in local co-op.
• Catrmageddon
Survival arena mode. Try survive wave after wave of enemies for as long as possible. Up to 4 players in local co-op.

Your Ninja Master was abducted before your eyes! Pursue his tracks through the territories of your sworn enemies and free him from captivity! Be vigilant though; not everything is what it seems...

Story in Claws of Furry follows the old-school arcade path, meaning that less is more. The narrative has linear progression, with short cutscenes that progress the story, but fear not; the game focuses on what you really want: punching things.
